docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 3.--Telephone service between North and South America under the auspices of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company was officially opened at 11 o'clock this morning when President Hoover, from the Cabinet room of the Executive offices in the State, War and Navy Building,...
docs.abstract: Pres Hoover opens service to So Amer with exchange of greetings with Presidents of Chile and Uruguay

headline.main: HOOVER OPENS PHONE TO SOUTH AMERICA; Exchanges Greetings With the Presidents of Chile and Uruguay by New Radio Link. IRIGOYEN CABLES ILLNESS Physicians Advised Against Taking Part in the Ceremony, Argentine President Says. No Diplomatic Incident Seen. HOOVER OPENS PHONE TO SOUTH AMERICA Talks to Dr. Campisteguy. Uruguayan President's Reply. IRIGOYEN UNABLE TO JOIN. Buenos Aires Paper Says He Plans Exchange of Messages. Denies Irigoyen Is Ill. CEREMONY IS REBROADCAST. South American Phone Begins With Exceptional Clarity. CHILEAN CABINET LISTENS. Ambassador Culbertson Tells of Gains New Phone Service Promises
